paragraphs.text: And it’s amazing how quickly, once we let go of that fear, we wake up from the illusion. When we unplug for more than a day, unsubscribe from those notifications, or go to Camp Grounded — the concerns we thought we’d have don’t actually happen.
paragraphs.name: 0ba1

paragraphs.text: The problem is, maximizing interruptions in the name of business creates a tragedy of the commons, ruining global attention spans and causing billions of unnecessary interruptions each day. This is a huge problem we need to fix with shared design standards (potentially, as part of Time Well Spent).
paragraphs.name: 5e8b

paragraphs.text: In other words, interruption is good for business.
paragraphs.name: a5d2

paragraphs.text: When we tap the # of red notifications, we’re playing a slot machine to what’s underneath.
paragraphs.name: 02c7

paragraphs.text: Businesses naturally want to make the choices they want you to make easier, and the choices they don’t want you to make harder. Magicians do the same thing. You make it easier for a spectator to pick the thing you want them to pick, and harder to pick the thing you don’t.

Imagine millions of people getting interrupted like this throughout their day, running around like chickens with their heads cut off, reciprocating each other — all designed by companies who profit from it.
paragraphs.name: 71b6
